items.title: Meta's Aggressive AI Startup Talks and New AI Glasses Strategy
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary: - *Mark Zuckerberg* has explored acquiring AI startups like *Safe Superintelligence*, *Thinking Machines Lab*, and *Perplexity*, but deals fell through. - Meta is assembling a new AI team led by *Daniel Gross* and *Nat Friedman*, reporting to *Alexandr Wang*, after a $14B acquisition. - Meta emphasizes AI integration in *wearable AI glasses*, partnering with Oakley for a new product line, aiming to make AI the top usage feature.

items.title: Best Robot Vacuum Deals Right Now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Explore top robot vacuum deals from Roborock, Dreame, SwitchBot and more with discounts up to $800 off.  
- Featured models include Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra with powerful suction, Dreame X40 Ultra with self-cleaning mop pads, and SwitchBot S10 with hands-free water refill.  
- These affordable smart vacuums combine vacuuming and mopping, with advanced AI navigation and app controls to keep floors clean effortlessly.

items.title: The best Apple deals you can shop ahead of Amazon Prime Day
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Apple products including the latest AirPods, iPad Air, and M4 Mac Mini are already available at *steep discounts* ahead of Amazon Prime Day (July 8-11, 2025).
- Deals cover earbuds, laptops, tablets, Apple Watch, and accessories, with prices matching or close to all-time lows.
- Notably, AirPods 4 with ANC are $148.99, iPad Air 11-inch at $499, MacBook Air M4 13-inch at $849, and Apple Watch Series 10 at $329.
- Many deals are available beyond Amazon, including Walmart, Best Buy, and Target, *no Prime membership required*.

items.title: 28 Years Later is a bleak fever dream with rage pumping through its veins
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: - *28 Years Later* revisits the zombie outbreak with a focus on a British island community grappling with survival and lingering nationalism. - The film introduces evolved infected types and showcases visually stunning action sequences but suffers from familiar plot beats and questionable character decisions. - While visually impressive, its conservative messaging and tone dampen the original's visceral impact, leaving potential for improvement in upcoming trilogy installments.

items.title: Apple’s tiny M4 Mac mini hits lowest price ever
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary:
- Apple’s latest *M4 Mac Mini* with 512GB storage and 16GB RAM is on sale for *$689* and the 256GB model for *$469*, both at all-time low prices.
- The Mac Mini is praised for its compact size, strong performance on high-res tasks, and abundant ports including Thunderbolt 3 and HDMI.
- Additional deals include *Powerbeats Pro 2 earbuds* at $199.95, Arlo security cameras, and Marshall Emberton III speaker matching their best prices.

items.title: Applebee’s and IHOP Plan AI-Powered Menu Recommendations
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- **Applebee’s** and **IHOP** are developing an AI-powered personalization engine to recommend and upsell menu items based on customer purchase history.
- The AI aims to boost customer loyalty and enhance dining experience, with potential staff tools like AI cameras and management apps under consideration.
- Other chains like **Wendy’s**, **McDonald’s**, and **Taco Bell** are also expanding AI use for ordering and operational efficiency.

items.title: How to Find the Best Deals During Amazon Prime Day 2025
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary: Amazon Prime Day 2025 spans four days with major discounts on top brands and various products. This article offers essential strategies and tools like price-tracking extensions, deal alerts via Alexa and apps, and tips to find deals beyond Amazon, enabling shoppers to maximize savings efficiently.

items.title: Amazon enhances Kindle accessibility with new customizable text spacing features
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: Amazon's latest Kindle software update introduces advanced text spacing controls, including line, paragraph, word, and character spacing adjustments, significantly improving readability and accessibility. These features support users with visual impairments and dyslexia, making Kindle a more inclusive e-reader option. This update marks a substantial step forward in user customization and accessibility.

items.title: Microsoft's Family Safety Feature Blocks Google Chrome on Windows
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: Microsoft’s Family Safety parental control feature is causing Google Chrome to be blocked or closed on Windows, affecting users and schools. While other browsers remain unaffected, no fix timing is announced, urging users to disable some safety filters as a workaround. This issue highlights ongoing tensions in browser competition.

items.title: Tesla’s Robotaxi Service to Launch with Front Seat Safety Monitor Despite Previous 'No One in the Car' Promise
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Tesla is launching its robotaxi rides with a mandatory human safety monitor in the front passenger seat, contradicting Elon Musk’s earlier claim of fully unsupervised trips. This approach reflects Tesla’s cautious rollout amidst regulatory scrutiny and technical challenges, highlighting the complexities of deploying autonomous vehicles safely.

items.title: Inside Trump Mobile: The Reality Behind the Trump Phone and Its Market Impact
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: This Vergecast episode unpacks Trump Mobile’s business model, the questionable value of its touted $500 ‘made-in-America’ phone, and its position amid burgeoning MVNO competition. It also discusses rapid changes in TV viewing trends, revealing insights crucial for understanding emerging tech markets and media consumption shifts in 2025.

items.title: Meta and Oakley Launch New Smart Glasses Focused on Athletes
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary: Meta and Oakley introduced the Oakley Meta HSTN smart glasses priced at $499, designed for athletes with improved battery life, 3K video camera, and water resistance. These AI-powered glasses enable music, calls, translation, and visual assistance, marking Meta's expansion into performance-oriented smart eyewear.

items.title: How ChatGPT Is Changing the Way We Speak and Write
items.author: Sara Parker
items.summary: ChatGPT is subtly reshaping our language by increasing the use of certain words and influencing speech patterns, leading to more uniform yet less emotionally expressive communication. This shift raises concerns about authenticity, trust, and linguistic diversity, highlighting the importance of consciously preserving human quirks in AI-mediated dialogue.

items.title: How Astro Bot Became a Beloved PlayStation Icon Through Thoughtful Design
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Astro Bot's director Nicolas Doucet reveals how late-stage character animations and thoughtful design choices made the robot an endearing PlayStation figure. Originating from a 2013 PS4 game, Astro's appeal lies in subtle, consistent quality over time, highlighting how small details enhance player engagement.

items.title: Acer Swift 14 AI Review: Excellent Ports and Battery Life but Mediocre Display and Speakers
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary: The Acer Swift 14 AI impresses with strong performance, exceptional battery life, and a versatile array of ports, ideal for productivity. However, its display quality, webcam, and especially speakers disappoint, making it less appealing compared to similarly priced competitors. This review is essential for buyers prioritizing connectivity and endurance.

items.title: Texas’ Laissez-Faire Law Spurs Tesla's Autonomous Vehicle Testing and Raises Safety Concerns
items.author: Mack DeGeurin
items.summary: Texas' permissive autonomous vehicle regulations have enabled Tesla to expedite its robotaxi program, positioning the state as a leader in AV deployment. However, safety advocates and local officials express concerns about limited oversight and the potential risks of a rushed rollout, highlighting the tension between innovation and public safety.

items.title: Adobe Launches Project Indigo, a Computational Photography Camera App for iPhones
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Adobe's new free app, Project Indigo, enhances iPhone photography by capturing multiple photos and combining them for higher quality and natural SLR-like images without requiring an Adobe login. Developed with computational photography expert Marc Levoy, it offers manual controls and promises future features like reflection removal, portrait mode, and video.

items.title: Spotify's HiFi Lossless Streaming May Launch Soon
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: After years of anticipation, Spotify is showing clear signs of launching its HiFi lossless streaming tier soon, with references found in new app versions and potential integration across devices. This move aligns Spotify with competitors like Apple Music and Amazon Music, enhancing audio quality for subscribers ready to pay more.

items.title: Eufy X10 Pro Omni Robot Vacuum Returns to Best Price with Advanced Cleaning Features
items.author: Brandon Russell
items.summary: The Eufy X10 Pro Omni offers an advanced robot vacuum and mop combo with AI-powered obstacle avoidance, powerful suction, and automated maintenance features. Now at its lowest price ever, it provides versatile and efficient cleaning for various surfaces while minimizing user effort. A smart choice for hassle-free home cleaning this spring.

items.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Introduces Even Harder Everdark Sovereign Bosses
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Elden Ring Nightreign introduces Everdark Sovereigns, more challenging versions of Nightlord bosses with new moves and increased power, available online for a limited time. Defeating them rewards special items, with more Everdark bosses rolling out weekly. This adds fresh difficulty for seasoned players seeking tougher challenges.

items.title: Midjourney Launches AI Tool for Creating Short Videos from Images
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Midjourney has introduced its first AI video generation model, allowing users to create short 5- to 21-second clips from images using text prompts. This tool expands creative possibilities for AI-generated content, highlighting the ongoing innovations and challenges in AI video technology, making it relevant for creators and tech enthusiasts.

items.title: Inside Microsoft’s Complex and Strained Partnership with OpenAI
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: Microsoft and OpenAI’s $13 billion partnership faces tension as OpenAI seeks more compute power and less dependence on Microsoft, risking antitrust scrutiny. Complex revenue-sharing and competitive dynamics illustrate the high stakes and evolving nature of their relationship, critical to understanding future AI industry shifts.

items.title: DOJ Moves to Seize $225 Million in Cryptocurrency From Pig Butchering Scammers
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary: The DOJ filed to seize $225 million in crypto linked to sophisticated pig butchering scams that defrauded over 400 victims. The seizure targets money laundering networks tied to Tether stablecoins, aiming to recover funds for victims amid rising crypto investment fraud losses. This underscores law enforcement's efforts against large-scale crypto scams.

items.title: Eero’s speedy Pro 6E mesh system is on sale with a gift card for $200 off
FBC: Firebreak Struggles to Capture the Unique Charm of Control
items.author: Tauriq Moosa
items.summary: FBC: Firebreak, set in the Control universe, fails to deliver the series’ trademark weirdness and depth, offering a generic co-op shooter experience with repetitive missions and limited progression. Fans of Control may find it lacking, while shooter enthusiasts will encounter little fresh gameplay, marking it as a disappointing entry from Remedy Entertainment.

items.title: Comprehensive Overview of Price-Matching Policies at Major Retailers
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: This article details the price-matching policies of leading retailers like Best Buy, Target, Amazon, and more, highlighting each store's rules, exceptions, and key restrictions. It offers essential insights for consumers looking to save money across various shopping events and informs on how to navigate price adjustments effectively.

items.title: Steam Introduces New Accessibility Features Including Screen Reader Support
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary: Valve is rolling out accessibility features in Steam’s latest beta, adding screen reader support, text scaling, high-contrast mode, and motion reduction to assist players with disabilities. These tools enhance usability across SteamOS and Big Picture Mode, making gaming more inclusive and customizable.

items.title: AI Art Residencies Empower Artists to Shape the Future of Artificial Intelligence in Art
items.author: Deena Mousa
items.summary: AI art residencies worldwide are enabling artists to experiment with generative technology, influencing public perception and the cultural framing of AI art. These programs foster creative exploration while addressing complex issues around authorship, fairness, and the distribution of AI's benefits, making them crucial to the evolving art and AI landscape.

items.title: Summer Game Fest 2025 Highlights Small, Personal Games with Deep Emotional Impact
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: Summer Game Fest 2025 showcased unique, heartfelt games emphasizing personal stories and creative expression, from puzzle-filled open worlds to emotionally charged narratives exploring loss and cultural restitution. These titles highlight the power of videogames as artistic, transformative experiences worth exploring.

items.title: SpaceX Starship Explodes During Static Fire Test at Starbase
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary: During a static fire test of Starship Ship 36 at Starbase, Texas, SpaceX experienced a major explosion with no injuries reported. This incident continues a pattern of explosions during recent Starship tests, highlighting the risks in advancing rocket technology. It emphasizes ongoing challenges in achieving reliable spaceflight.

items.title: Current Best Deals on Apple iPads in 2025
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary: This article details the latest discounts available on Apple's 2025 iPad lineup, including the 11th-gen iPad, iPad Mini, iPad Air, and iPad Pro models with new chips and features. It highlights where to find the best prices and explains the key upgrades, helping buyers make informed choices on when and what to purchase.

items.title: Best Streaming Service Deals to Save Money in 2025
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: This article highlights the top current deals across leading streaming platforms like Peacock, Disney Plus, Hulu, and Sling TV, helping subscribers save money while enjoying diverse content. It emphasizes available discounts, bundles, and promotions relevant for budget-conscious viewers seeking value in 2025.

items.title: Ancestra Highlights Both Potential and Limitations of AI-Generated Film
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: Eliza McNitt’s short film Ancestra, created with Google DeepMind’s AI tools, showcases generative AI’s ability to produce unique visuals but also reveals current technical and narrative limitations. It sparks necessary debate on AI’s impact in filmmaking, especially concerning job displacement and creative authenticity, underscoring cautious adoption.

items.title: YouTube to Integrate Veo 3 AI Video Generation into Shorts This Summer
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: YouTube will introduce its advanced Veo 3 AI video generation model to Shorts later this summer, enhancing video quality and audio incorporation. This update could transform content creation on Shorts, which already sees over 200 billion daily views, signaling major growth in AI-driven video production tools.

items.title: Death Stranding Expands with a New Animated Film Adaptation
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary: Death Stranding is evolving with an upcoming animated film written by Aaron Guzikowski, offering fresh stories within its complex universe. This spinoff precedes the release of Death Stranding 2 and complements a live-action movie, highlighting the franchise's growing cinematic presence. Fans should anticipate new creative expansions of Kojima's acclaimed world.

items.title: Which Webcams Are Compatible with Nintendo Switch 2?
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary: The Nintendo Switch 2 supports video chat with either its official camera or select USB webcams, but many popular USB-C webcams fail to work. A crowdsourced list from Reddit and tests confirm compatibility varies widely, highlighting the need for careful webcam selection for Switch 2 users.

items.title: Facebook Introduces Passkey Support to Enhance Account Security
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Facebook is implementing passkey support on its mobile app to strengthen security by enabling logins through biometric or device authentication, reducing phishing risks. This advancement aligns with broader industry moves to safer, passwordless authentication methods, enhancing user protection and ease of access.

items.title: How Artists Are Navigating the Rise of AI in Creative Fields
items.author: Jacob Kastrenakes
items.summary: AI technologies are rapidly transforming the arts, prompting creators to either embrace, resist, or adapt to these changes. This article explores diverse artist responses, from perfumers to illustrators, highlighting the search for balance amid AI's disruptive impact. It offers insight into the evolving relationship between art and technology, crucial for understanding the future of creativity.

items.title: NFC Release 15 Boosts Contactless Range and Reliability
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: The upcoming NFC Release 15 standard significantly extends NFC range from 0.5cm to 2cm, enhancing device alignment and speeding up contactless payments. This update supports smaller devices and more complex interactions, offering greater convenience for users and advancing NFC technology's practical applications.

items.title: How The Roottrees are Dead transitioned from AI-generated art to hand-illustrated success
items.author: Jay Castello
items.summary: The indie game The Roottrees are Dead initially used AI-generated art but faced ethical and platform restrictions, leading to hand-illustrated replacements. This shift boosted its critical and commercial success, highlighting the complex balance between AI tools and traditional artistry in game development.

items.title: Waymo Plans to Launch Autonomous Robotaxi Service in New York City Pending Legal Changes
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: Waymo aims to introduce a fully autonomous robotaxi service in New York City but must first change state laws requiring safety drivers. The initiative highlights challenges of navigating NYC’s dense, chaotic streets, underscoring the importance of legal and technological advancements in urban autonomous driving. This development signals a major step for autonomous vehicle adoption in complex urban environments.

items.title: Google Introduces Real-Time AI Voice Chats in Search with Search Live
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Google is testing Search Live in AI Mode, enabling real-time voice conversations with its AI chatbot directly in the Google app. This feature enhances search interactions by providing spoken responses and relevant links, marking a significant step in AI-driven, interactive search experiences for users in the US.

items.title: Discounts on Animal Crossing LEGO Sets and Other Tech Deals
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: Animal Crossing LEGO sets, especially the K.K. Slider concert diorama, are now available at reduced prices, making them an ideal buy for fans. Additionally, notable deals include Motorola’s 2024 Edge phone and Apple’s latest MacBook Air, offering significant savings on popular tech products. These promotions provide excellent value for gamers and tech enthusiasts alike.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy A36 5G Hits Lowest Price with Feature-Rich Midrange Phone
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: Samsung’s Galaxy A36 5G is now available at its lowest price of $349.99, offering a large 6.7-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 processor, and six years of software updates. This affordable midrange phone combines durable build and strong features, making it a compelling budget Android choice.

items.title: Exploring AI Creativity Without Any Training Data
items.author: Franklin Schneider
items.summary: Artist Terence Broad developed a method to generate AI artwork without training on any data by looping neural networks against each other, revealing AI’s latent creativity. This innovative approach challenges conventional AI ethics and highlights the mystery and potential in AI’s internal processes beyond derivative outputs.

items.title: The Rise of Celebrity-Backed Mobile Virtual Network Operators
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary: Celebrity-backed mobile virtual network operators (MVNOs) are surging, driven by advancements like 5G and eSIM technology. Ryan Reynolds' success with Mint Mobile has inspired others, including political figures, to enter the wireless service market, reflecting a shift in branding strategies and consumer accessibility. This trend highlights the evolving telecom landscape and celebrity influence.

items.title: Govee Table Lamp 2 Pro X Sound by JBL: A Smart Light with Party Speaker Features
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: The Govee Table Lamp 2 Pro X Sound by JBL combines vibrant smart lighting with a decent Bluetooth speaker, making it a versatile and fun addition to home gatherings. It supports smart home integration and offers impressive light effects but lacks bass depth and outdoor durability. Ideal for adding ambiance and music in indoor settings.

items.title: Framework Laptop 12 Review: A Colorful, Repairable Convertible with Mid-Range Performance
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary: Framework's Laptop 12 is a vibrant, modular 2-in-1 touchscreen laptop emphasizing repairability and upgradeability with a solid build and fun design. Despite its aging Intel i3 chip and some mediocre features, it offers unique customization options making it ideal for enthusiasts valuing longevity over raw power.

items.title: Honda Achieves Successful Launch and Landing of Experimental Reusable Rocket
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: Honda successfully launched and landed its first experimental reusable rocket during a test in Japan, marking a significant milestone in its aerospace ambitions. The 21-foot rocket reached 890 feet and landed within 37cm of its target, showcasing advanced landing precision. This progress advances Honda's 2029 goal of achieving suborbital flights and signals a growing push in private space exploration technologies.

items.title: Summer Game Fest 2025 in LA: Gaming Amidst Political Tension and Protests
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: Summer Game Fest 2025 offered gaming excitement shadowed by intense political unrest as ICE raids in LA ignited protests near the event. The article reveals the complex interplay of celebration and fear, highlighting the gaming community’s resilience amid social turmoil and reminding readers why this moment matters.
